G.T.5586
SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 30th AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
South of the SOMME our troops hold the line of the river to PERONNE and have 3 posts across the river.
North of the SOMME we took the village of CLERY this morning. From there northwards our line runs :- East of MAUREPAS, east of COMBLES, east of MORVAL, west of RIENCOURT-LES-BAPAUME, west of BAINCOURT, west of FREMICOURT, west of VRAUCOURT, west of ECOUST ST. MEIN, (which place we attacked this morning), thence the line runs due east, south of BULLECOURT, 1,000 yards south-east of RIENCOURT-LES-CAGNICOURT, thence north, east of RIENCOURT, east of HENDECOURT CHATEAU, (from HENDECOURT CHATEAU to the ARRAS - CAMBRAI Road our troops attacked this morning, and have made considerable progress), east of REME, along the river to east of LANNOY MILL, thence north to east of KASHMIR WOOD, thence 1,000 yards east of PELVES west of PLOUVAIN, GREENLAND HILL, (inclusive), GAVRELLE (inclusive) OPPY, (exclusive).
French Front.
There is no change in the situation.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
30th August, 1918.
Issued at 1 p.m.
For the personal information of the Minister only.
